name: Topup Loan for Home loan borrowers
description: At Bank of Maharashtra, we recognize that your home is more than just a place to live - it's a canvas for your dreams and aspirations. That's why our top up loan on home loan offers the perfect solution for existing home loan customers who are looking to add value. Whether you are planning to furnish your home, fund necessary repairs, or renovate your home, our top up loan on home loan provides the ideal financial support without the burden of high costs.

faqs.question: What is a Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: A Top-Up Loan is an additional loan that can be availed by existing housing loan borrowers to meet various personal purpose such as meeting expenditure on Children's Education, Marriage of Children, Medical treatment etc. other than speculative purpose. It is secured against the same property that is already mortgaged for the existing housing loan.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for a Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: Borrowers including NRIs/PIOs who have an existing housing loan with a good repayment track record of last 12 months in existing Housing Loan. The property against which the original housing loan was sanctioned will continue as security for the top-up loan.

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount I can get through the Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: The maximum top-up loan amount is 200% of the existing housing loan Sanctioned Limit or Rs. 10 Crore, whichever is lower.

faqs.question: What is the Loan to Value (LTV) ratio for a Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: For loans up to Rs. 75 Lakhs: The LTV ratio is 80% with a 20% margin. For loans above Rs. 75 Lakhs: The LTV ratio is 75% with a 25% margin.

faqs.question: What is the repayment period for the Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: The repayment period for the top-up loan is aligned with the existing home loan, up to a maximum of 180 months or until the borrower reaches the age of 75 years, whichever is earlier.

faqs.question: What is the maximum quantum of loan?
faqs.answer: Minimum Loan Amount: Rs. 1 Lakh Maximum Loan Amount: Rs. 10 Crore The loan quantum may be up to 200% of the Housing Loan sanction limit for those who have repaid for more than 2 years after commencement of repayment, or Rs. 10 crore, whichever is lower. For Housing loans who have repaid for more than 1 year and upto 2 years after commencement of repayment, the loan quantum may be 125% of Housing Loan sanction limit.

faqs.question: What is the maximum age at loan maturity?
faqs.answer: The age at loan maturity should not exceed 75 years. This is subject to an assessment of the applicant's income to ensure they can meet repayment obligations until the age of 75 years. For individuals with income only up to 60 years, the loan term should not exceed the age of 60 years unless there is a proven source of income post-retirement.

faqs.question: What are the interest rates on the Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: Interest rates for the top-up loan are competitive and depend on various factors, including the borrower’s CIBIL score. Presently, Rate of Interest starts at ‘Home Loan rate + 0.50% p.a’.

faqs.question: What is the moratorium period for the loan?
faqs.answer: There is no moratorium period; the repayment starts from next month after loan sanction.

faqs.question: Are co-applicants required for a top-up loan?
faqs.answer: Yes, all co-owners of the property and co-applicants on the existing home loan must be included as co-applicants for the top-up loan.

faqs.question: What is the maximum number of top-up loans allowed?
faqs.answer: A maximum of two top-up loans can be taken against the same property, subject to LTV norms.

faqs.question: Are there any processing charges for the Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: Yes, the processing charges are 0.50% of the loan amount, with a maximum of Rs. 50,000/- excluding GST.

faqs.question: How is the Top-Up Loan disbursed?
faqs.answer: The loan can be disbursed as a lump sum or in stages, depending on the borrower’s requirements. The amount is usually credited to the borrower's Savings/Current account through RTGS/NEFT.

faqs.question: Can I use the Top-Up Loan for any purpose?
faqs.answer: Yes, the top-up loan can be used for a various personal purpose such as meeting expenditure on Children's Education, Marriage of Children, Medical treatment etc. other than speculative purpose.

faqs.question: What security is required for the Top-Up Loan?
faqs.answer: The top-up loan is secured against the same property that is mortgaged for the existing home loan.

faqs.question: Can I prepay my Top-Up Loan without any penalties?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are no prepayment charges for the Top-Up Loan.
